chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sex Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations 1st Degree w/ Child under 13 & Harm
Repeated Sex Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations 1st Degree w/ Child under 13 & Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kheng NMI Yang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Causing Mental Harm to Child, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sex Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations 1st Degree w/ Child under 13 & Harm

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued. The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  Defendant to complete Sex Offender Treatment.  Defendant to comply with Sex Offender Registry.  The Defendant is to have no contact with E.Y. without prior approval from agent.  The Defendant is to have no unsupervised contact with anyone under age of 18 years old without prior approval of the agent. The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis, unless already provided.

timeConds.notes: Work release granted for work and school.
